activity: EL PARAGUAS (umbrella) - Masculine, invariable plural.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun PARAGUAS (umbrella). Masculine: el paraguas, los paraguas (same form for singular and plural). Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA GENTE (people) - Feminine singular. Practice usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun GENTE (people). Feminine and singular in Spanish: la gente es (not son). Unlike English 'people'. Test me with article and verb agreement. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA FAMILIA (family) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun FAMILIA (family). Feminine: la familia, las familias. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL ABUELO / LA ABUELA (grandparent) - Practice both genders.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun ABUELO/ABUELA (grandfather/grandmother). Masculine: el abuelo. Feminine: la abuela. Note: los abuelos = grandparents. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL TÍO / LA TÍA (uncle/aunt) - Practice both genders.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun TÍO/TÍA (uncle/aunt). Masculine: el tío. Feminine: la tía. Note: 'tío/tía' also means 'guy/girl' colloquially in Spain. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL PRIMO / LA PRIMA (cousin) - Practice both genders.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun PRIMO/PRIMA (cousin). Masculine: el primo. Feminine: la prima. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL SOBRINO / LA SOBRINA (nephew/niece) - Practice both genders.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun SOBRINO/SOBRINA (nephew/niece). Masculine: el sobrino. Feminine: la sobrina. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL SUEGRO / LA SUEGRA (in-law parent) - Practice both genders.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun SUEGRO/SUEGRA (father-in-law/mother-in-law). Masculine: el suegro. Feminine: la suegra. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL CUÑADO / LA CUÑADA (sibling-in-law) - Practice both genders.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun CUÑADO/CUÑADA (brother-in-law/sister-in-law). Masculine: el cuñado. Feminine: la cuñada. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL NOVIO / LA NOVIA (boyfriend/girlfriend) - Practice both genders.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun NOVIO/NOVIA (boyfriend/girlfriend, also groom/bride). Masculine: el novio. Feminine: la novia. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL MARIDO (husband) - Masculine noun. Practice usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun MARIDO (husband). Masculine: el marido, los maridos. Alternative: el esposo. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA ESPOSA (wife) - Feminine noun. Practice usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun ESPOSA (wife). Feminine: la esposa, las esposas. Note: 'las esposas' also means 'handcuffs'. Alternative: la mujer. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL VECINO / LA VECINA (neighbor) - Practice both genders.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun VECINO/VECINA (neighbor). Masculine: el vecino. Feminine: la vecina. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL JEFE / LA JEFA (boss) - Practice both genders.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun JEFE/JEFA (boss). Masculine: el jefe. Feminine: la jefa. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL COMPAÑERO / LA COMPAÑERA (colleague/partner) - Practice both genders.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun COMPAÑERO/COMPAÑERA (colleague/partner/classmate). Masculine: el compañero. Feminine: la compañera. Common: compañero de trabajo. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL/LA CLIENTE (client) - Same form, different article.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun CLIENTE (client/customer). Same form for both: el cliente (male), la cliente (female). Some use 'la clienta'. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL ESCRITOR / LA ESCRITORA (writer) - Practice both genders.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun ESCRITOR/ESCRITORA (writer). Masculine: el escritor. Feminine: la escritora. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL ACTOR / LA ACTRIZ (actor) - Practice both genders.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun ACTOR/ACTRIZ (actor/actress). Masculine: el actor. Feminine: la actriz (note different form). Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL/LA CANTANTE (singer) - Same form, different article.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun CANTANTE (singer). Same form for both: el cantante (male), la cantante (female). Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL/LA POLICÍA (police officer) vs LA POLICÍA (police force).

activity: EL/LA PERIODISTA (journalist) - Same form, different article.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun PERIODISTA (journalist). Same form for both: el periodista (male), la periodista (female). Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL/LA DEPORTISTA (athlete) - Same form, different article.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun DEPORTISTA (athlete). Same form for both: el deportista (male), la deportista (female). Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL CONDUCTOR / LA CONDUCTORA (driver) - Practice both genders.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun CONDUCTOR/CONDUCTORA (driver). Masculine: el conductor. Feminine: la conductora. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL COCINERO / LA COCINERA (cook) - Practice both genders.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun COCINERO/COCINERA (cook). Masculine: el cocinero. Feminine: la cocinera. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL INGENIERO / LA INGENIERA (engineer) - Practice both genders.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun INGENIERO/INGENIERA (engineer). Masculine: el ingeniero. Feminine: la ingeniera. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL ARQUITECTO / LA ARQUITECTA (architect) - Practice both genders.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun ARQUITECTO/ARQUITECTA (architect). Masculine: el arquitecto. Feminine: la arquitecta. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL/LA PILOTO (pilot) - Same form, different article.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun PILOTO (pilot). Usually: el piloto (male), la piloto (female) - same form. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL SOLDADO / LA SOLDADO (soldier) - Practice usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun SOLDADO (soldier). Traditionally masculine. For women: la soldado (modern) or la mujer soldado. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun CIENCIA (science). Feminine: la ciencia, las ciencias. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA TECNOLOGÍA (technology) - Feminine noun. Practice usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun TECNOLOGÍA (technology). Feminine: la tecnología, las tecnologías. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA MEDICINA (medicine) - Feminine noun. Practice meanings.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun MEDICINA (medicine). Feminine: la medicina, las medicinas. Two meanings: the field of medicine and a medication. Test me with sentences using both meanings. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA ECONOMÍA (economy) - Feminine noun. Practice usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun ECONOMÍA (economy/economics). Feminine: la economía, las economías. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA POLÍTICA (politics/policy) - Feminine noun. Practice meanings.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun POLÍTICA (politics/policy). Feminine: la política, las políticas. Two meanings: politics and policy. Note: el/la político/a = politician. Test me with sentences using different meanings. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA CULTURA (culture) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun CULTURA (culture). Feminine: la cultura, las culturas. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA RELIGIÓN (religion) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun RELIGIÓN (religion). Feminine: la religión, las religiones. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA EDUCACIÓN (education) - Feminine noun. Practice usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun EDUCACIÓN (education). Feminine: la educación. Also means 'manners' (tener educación = be polite). Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA UNIVERSIDAD (university) - Feminine noun. Practice usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun UNIVERSIDAD (university). Feminine: la universidad, las universidades. Common: ir a la universidad. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL COLEGIO (school) - Masculine noun. Practice usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun COLEGIO (school - usually primary/secondary). Masculine: el colegio, los colegios. Common: ir al colegio. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA ESCUELA (school) - Feminine noun. Practice usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun ESCUELA (school). Feminine: la escuela, las escuelas. Common: ir a la escuela. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL INSTITUTO (high school/institute) - Masculine noun.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun INSTITUTO (high school in Spain/institute). Masculine: el instituto, los institutos. Common: ir al instituto. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA ASIGNATURA (subject/course) - Feminine noun. Practice usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun ASIGNATURA (school subject). Feminine: la asignatura, las asignaturas. Common: ¿Cuál es tu asignatura favorita? Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun EXAMEN (exam). Masculine: el examen, los exámenes. Common: hacer un examen, aprobar/suspender un examen. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL DERECHO (right/law) - Masculine noun. Practice meanings.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun DERECHO (right/law). Masculine: el derecho, los derechos. Two meanings: a right (human rights) and law (the field). Test me with sentences using both meanings. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA LEY (law) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun LEY (law - a specific law). Feminine: la ley, las leyes. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA LIBERTAD (freedom) - Feminine noun. Practice usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun LIBERTAD (freedom/liberty). Feminine: la libertad, las libertades. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA SEGURIDAD (security/safety) - Feminine noun. Practice usage.

activity: LA SALUD (health) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun SALUD (health). Feminine: la salud. Also used as toast: ¡Salud! (Cheers!). Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA ENFERMEDAD (illness) - Feminine noun. Practice usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun ENFERMEDAD (illness/disease). Feminine: la enfermedad, las enfermedades. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun DOLOR (pain). Masculine: el dolor, los dolores. Common: dolor de cabeza, tengo dolor. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA FIEBRE (fever) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun FIEBRE (fever). Feminine: la fiebre. Common: tener fiebre. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA GRIPE (flu) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun GRIPE (flu). Feminine: la gripe. Common: tener la gripe. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL SUEÑO (dream/sleep) - Masculine noun. Practice meanings.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun SUEÑO (dream/sleep/sleepiness). Masculine: el sueño, los sueños. Three meanings: a dream, sleep, and being sleepy (tener sueño). Test me with sentences using different meanings. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL HAMBRE (hunger) - Feminine but uses 'el'. Practice usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun HAMBRE (hunger). Feminine but uses 'el' in singular (el hambre) to avoid 'la a-' sound. Plural: las hambres. Common: tener hambre. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA SED (thirst) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun SED (thirst). Feminine: la sed. Common: tener sed. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL FRÍO (cold) - Masculine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun FRÍO (cold). Masculine: el frío. Common: hace frío (it's cold weather), tener frío (to be/feel cold). Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL CALOR (heat) - Masculine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun CALOR (heat). Masculine: el calor. Common: hace calor (it's hot weather), tener calor (to be/feel hot). Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL MIEDO (fear) - Masculine noun. Practice gender and usage.

activity: LA SUERTE (luck) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.

prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun DISTANCIA (distance). Feminine: la distancia, las distancias. Common: a distancia. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.
